intro: Tragia hieronymi, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and it has a woody stem with thorny branches. Tragia hieronymi is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
